sentence.Network_en: The film was so abysmal that I fell asleep.

sentence.Network_en: The general standard of racing was abysmal.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (used literally as in sense 2): from abysm. Sense 1dates from the early 19th cent

entry.def: If you describe a situation or the condition of something as abysmal, you think that it is very bad or poor in quality.

example.ex: ...our abysmal record at producing a scientifically trained workforce...
example.tran: 我们在培育具有科学素养的专业人才方面惨不忍睹的记录

example.ex: The general standard of racing was abysmal.

means.word_mean: 2. so deep as to be unmeasurable;
